TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed IdentitySection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection
Public NotInheritable Class IdentitySection Inherits ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Configures the identity of a Web application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection> provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `identity` section of a configuration file.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection> can read and write information from and to the related section of the configuration file according to the section property <xref:System.Configuration.SectionInformation.AllowDefinition%2A> whose value is <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationAllowDefinition.Everywhere>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to obtain the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection> object from the configuration file of an existing Web application.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection/CS/identitysection.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection/VB/identitysection.vb" id="Snippet1":::

Docs.related: Using IIS Authentication With ASP.NET Impersonation

member this.Impersonate : bool with get, set
public: property bool Impersonate { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether client impersonation is used on each request.
Docs.value: if client impersonation is used; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Impersonate%2A> property is set to `true`, each request is served by a Web application impersonating its client. That is, either the user currently logged on or the user specified by the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A> properties. When the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Impersonate%2A> property is set to `false`, the application does not impersonate any client user.
> [!NOTE] > For security reasons, the identity section supports storage of the encrypted <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to access the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Impersonate%2A> property. Refer to the code example of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection> class to learn how to access the section.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection/CS/identitysection.cs" id="Snippet5"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection/VB/identitysection.vb" id="Snippet5":::

Docs.related: Using IIS Authentication With ASP.NET Impersonation

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Password : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ Password { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the password to use for impersonation.
Docs.value: The password to use for impersonation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because the password is stored in clear text, an authenticated user with proper credentials on the domain where the server resides can read it.
> [!NOTE] > For security reasons, the identity section supports storage of the encrypted <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to access the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A> property. Refer to the code example of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection> class to learn how to access the section.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection/CS/identitysection.cs" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection/VB/identitysection.vb" id="Snippet3":::

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the user name to use for impersonation.
Docs.value: The user name to use for impersonation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because the user name is stored in clear text, an authenticated user with proper credentials on the domain where the server resides can read it.
> [!NOTE] > For security reasons, the identity section supports storage of the encrypted <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to access the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> property. Refer to the code example of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection> class to learn how to access the section.
